newsitem.title: USA: Motorola unit sees production efficiencies.
newsitem.headline: Motorola unit sees production efficiencies.

text.p: Cadence Design Systems Inc and Motorola Inc's Logic and Analog Technologies Group said on Monday it completed a program to streamline production of certain semiconductors.
Motorola said it estimated an annual savings of nearly $12 million by cutting the time it took to develop software libraries to create its specialized analog circuits.

"We couldn't endure the long library development cycles anymore that were keeping marketable products from reaching the shelves," said Motorola's Rick Goeld, vice president and director of group strategy for Motorola's LATG.
Motorola worked with Cadence's service organization team to reduce time needed to produce a customer specified integrated circuit from months to seven days, it said.
The process used Cadence's design process transformation methodology to identify problems and tailor customer solutions.
